bug.short_desc: Allow filter to search on the entire message

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; fr; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Lightning/1.0b2 Thunderbird/3.1.9
I need to move messages into special folders on the fact they have a .PDF or a .DOC file attachment.
But Thunderbird filtering capability doesn't permit to create filter which allows to search: a) on the entire message. Even with customized keywords. b) on keywords of attachment header (like Content-Type). The search is restricted to the message header.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Send to yourself a mail with a PDF attachment 2. Create a new filter Filter name: PDF Apply filter when: Checking mail or run manually Match all the following 3. Create a new search keyword Customize... Content-Type 4. "Content-Type" "contains" "application/pdf;" 5. Perform these actions Add Star 6. Select the new filter and click on the button "Run now" Actual Results: Nothing happens
Expected Results: Thunderbird should check all Content-Type keywords existing in the entire message, find the string "application/pdf;" and perform the Add-Star action.
